experiences.title: Software Engineer ll
experiences.description:
- Designed and architected multiple high-availability, customer-facing services, enhancing user experience and scalability.
- Led implementation efforts, employing agile methodologies to deliver robust and efficient code solutions.
- Collaborated cross-functionally with product managers and UX/UI designers to ensure seamless integration of features.
- Deployed services using CI/CD pipelines, ensuring reliable and rapid releases.
- Resolved complex technical issues, optimizing performance and maintaining service uptime

experiences.title: Software Engineer Intern
experiences.description:
- Independently developed an ML-driven solution to replace Conductor's current SERP(Search Engine Result Page) parser, which produces useful insights into client rankings on search engine result pages, like Google, under the Kernel-Panic team's guidance.
- Extensively used Java, Spark, and Springboot to extract data from different repositories, performed feature extraction, and trained a Random Forest Model using Spark's ML libraries.
- Due to the success of the project, it will be used as a starting point to refine and expand upon and will be integrated into their primary architecture.

experiences.title: Undergraduate Research Assistant
experiences.description:
• Selected based on an application process to work in the Collaborative Robotics lab on the Programming by Demonstration (PBD) project, to help a robotic arm learn actions and movements the way humans do, by demonstrating them to it.
• Utilized Python-oriented Robotic Operating System (ROS) to help build the algorithm that implemented elements of Reinforcement Learning and Q-Learning. Also implemented Computer Vision to utilize for recognition of objects and actions.
• Participated in a month-long workshop to learn all elements of the project necessary. Then, assisted in implementing reinforcement learning, Q-learning, and deep Q-learning using python.

education.description: Skills: Computer Science · Back-End Web Development · Programming · Technical Architecture

accomplishment_organisations.title: Member
accomplishment_organisations.description:
Create a community for Indian students on campus.
Organize various Indian events on campus such as Diwali, Holi, etc.

accomplishment_organisations.title: Member
accomplishment_organisations.description:
RoboMasters takes part in the RoboMasters competition in Shenzen, China
Member of the software/autonomous team

accomplishment_projects.title: USC Compiler
accomplishment_projects.description:
• USC (University Simplified C) is a simplified version of C, created for this class for the purpose of building a compiler for it.
• Built a working Lexical Analyzer, Parser, Semantic Analyzer, Optimizer and Code translator to machine code using C++ and the LLVM API.

accomplishment_projects.title: Omilia
accomplishment_projects.description:
As a member of a 5-man team, developed a full stack social media web app, which combined features of Facebook, Twitter, and Reddit.
Web app was built using React.js and Node.js frameworks. Also used Firebase, Redux and MaterialUI.

accomplishment_projects.title: MyShell
accomplishment_projects.description:
Created a UNIX bash shell replica, using C, C++, with its own Grammar and Parsing Functionality implemented via a custom-made lexical analyzer and yacc parser.
Implemented I/O redirection, pipes, built-in functions, signal handling, subshells, variable expansion and wildcarding.

accomplishment_projects.title: TuneUp - Hackathon @ Purdue
accomplishment_projects.description: Took part in the Hello World Hackathon in Purdue University and was part of a team of 5 people that designed an app that played songs from your Spotify playlist by judging the current mood based on the weather and time of day, using Spotify, Accuweather and Google APIs.

accomplishment_projects.title: Athletics Timing System
accomplishment_projects.description: Part of a team that created a system to time athletes, using Raspberry PI and python, in the inter-house sports day.

volunteer_work.title: Team Leader International
volunteer_work.description: Was selected as a team leader international (TLi) for Purdue University’s orientation program for incoming freshmen called Boiler Gold Rush International and Boiler Gold Rush (BGRi/BGR). It involved a week-long rigorous training on intercultural sensitivity and logistics and planning campus activities for the incoming international and domestic freshmen. Shadowed the freshmen and led them around various campus activities. Had to foster an environment of support and friendship to ease their arrival into a new environment.

volunteer_work.title: Teaching Volunteer
volunteer_work.description: 60 hours of teaching English to underprivileged kids in a more expressive way by teaching them how to act, songs, dance, and in the end, a play
